definition: system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment

sentences.english: We know they are keen to see sanctions lifted.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道他們渴望看到制裁被取消。

sentences.english: Fourth, solve problems through consultation on an equal footing, instead of imposing restriction at will.
sentences.chinese: 通過平等協商解決問題，不要動輒設限和制裁。

sentences.english: The United Ns Security Council tooksanctionscontrary to the aggressor country.
sentences.chinese: 連結國安了解對侵略國採取了制裁措施。

sentences.english: We need to stop letting our Congress and the President get away withthe crimes their getting away with.
sentences.chinese: 不要再讓國會和總統逃脫出他們該受到的制裁。

sentences.english: One of the jurors immediately declares himself in favour of the utmost rigour of the law being applied to the young woman.
sentences.chinese: 有一名陪審員當即宣佈希望能用最嚴厲的法律制裁她。

sentences.english: If the task publishers had breached the entries listed tasks will probably face legal sanctions.
sentences.chinese: 若發佈任務者違反詞條列，將可能面對法律的制裁。

sentences.english: The two sides should seek consensus on major issues while reserving differences on minor issues, instead of imposing restrictions or sanctions at every turn.
sentences.chinese: 雙方應求大同存小異，不要動輒設限和制裁。

sentences.english: First, it's difficult to crack down on violators.
sentences.chinese: 第一，對違反規範者難以發揮制裁的效果。

sentences.english: This could include an international arms embargo and other targeted sanctions on Burma.
sentences.chinese: 這可包括國際性的武器禁運令和其他針對性的制裁。

sentences.english: On the other hand, we have sanctions which are strengthening the illegitimate government.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，制裁卻鞏固了這個非法政府的權力。

sentences.english: The sanctions againt the country fell into abeyance yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 對那個國家的制裁昨天中止。

sentences.english: He cheated the law by suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他以自殺逃避法律的制裁。

sentences.english: You will be punished by law for your intimidatory behavior.
sentences.chinese: 你的恐嚇行爲會遭到法律的制裁。

sentences.english: But the risk of sanctions can be significant to the company overall.
sentences.chinese: 但是制裁的風險對整個公司來說是重要的。

sentences.english: It wouldn't hurt the Syrian people, " said Tabler."
sentences.chinese: 因此制裁損害不了敘利亞人民。

sentences.english: That, in turn, could create a clear legal precedent for blocking unlicensed downloads.
sentences.chinese: 這樣會轉而爲制裁非授權下載開了明確的法律先例。

definition: to take countermeasures against/to hit back/to counter
